subject: Writing
title: William Howard Russell: The First War Reporter
description: A quick win: understand William Howard Russell: The First War Reporter.

hook.text: Before Russell, wars were reported as glorious victories. He showed the public what war actually looked like.

buildup.text: The Times of London sent Russell to cover the Crimean War in 1854.

discovery.text: His dispatches described incompetent generals, starving soldiers, and preventable deaths from disease.

twist.text: The British public was outraged â€” his reporting led to the fall of the government and Florence Nightingale's reforms.

climax.text: Russell proved that a journalist's pen could hold military leaders accountable to their own citizens.

punchline.text: He reported the truth and toppled a government.

quiz.question: What war did William Howard Russell report on?
